channel.title: Lawl&Shoot
channel.description:
Well, installed Linux - Ubuntu, and .exe programs wont install, nor will the internet, so I have no disk for windows XP, the boot at start-up only shows Ubuntu boots, what to do? oO
-M,i,k,e

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Mike is on a windows pc right now…

Just run the .exe and find where the drivers are extracted.

Read full topic

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You could transfer files a number of ways without the internet, a cd, a floppy disk, a zip drive, a usb flash drive. I still recommend hooking up to the internet with a wire until you get the wireless working.

Read full topic

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @M_i_K_e M,i,K,e
item.description:
@M_i_K_e wrote:

I’ve typed ‘WINE’ and it came up with some things, when I go to install, it says cannot connect to the internet. And how would I have these files transfered? With no internet.

-M,i,k,e

Read full topic

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Also official drivers that are .exe’s are simply compressed drivers (with the .inf file you need) so you can either run it with WINE in linux to extract it, or you can have someone with windows run it for you and transfer the files over.

Read full topic

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Yeah, just because the offical drivers are .exe doesn’t mean there aren’t drivers out their made for it. Just about any hardware will work on Linux as long as it isn’t reallly reallly old or reaaallly new.

Read full topic

item.description:

I don’t think there is a way to fix it, the installation for the wireless desktop card is .exe. Maybe I’ll buy a new wireless desktop card, that Linux does support.

-M,i,k,e

EDIT:
I guess I’ll look into it more actually.
Found a website page on how to install ‘anything’ on Ubuntu.
http://monkeyblog.org/ubuntu/installing/

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

M:

Can a moderator close this? Theres really no way to fix it, so I’ll learn more then try.

There really is a way to fix it, if you would take some time to try things and learn. It would also help if you put more details here, like the type of wireless card you have for instance.

Read full topic

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

For the internet:
Go into terminal and type: “sudo pppoe-config” It will ask you for your password, enter it. Then follow the on screen instructions.

If you want to run .exe’s, get wine by clicking “applications” > “add remove programs” > type “WINE” in the search box and press enter. When wine shows up, click it and click apply, it will then download.

Read full topic

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“M,i,K,e, post:18, topic:157192”]…

  • Most computers that do use window xp installation disks, require an installation number which mine does not have nor it wouldn’t register with the disk if it did have one.
    …[/quote]

        If by installation number you mean Activation number, all computers have them if they have a pre-installed OS, it must have one, your Compaq does, you just haven't bothered to look well enough. Is it a Laptop or Desktop computer? If it's a laptop it's underneath, it's a green tag. If it's a PC it can be in a number of places, on top of the Tower, on the left panel, on the inside of the tower, on the bottom, on the back, just search for it. If all else fails look through the booklet that came with your PC, it might could be in there. 

     If you do somehow find the activation key, you can order just the CD that goes with that OS directly from Microsoft, they're only $8.00 or $9.00 USD. That's if you need to go back to Windows XP.

For your internet problem, if you have a Router, and you were originally connecting to it wirelessly, you could just go to wal-mart and buy a cheap Blue-Tooth USB Wireless Adapter.

Read full topic

  • Most computers that do use window xp installation disks, require an installation number which mine does not have nor it wouldn’t register with the disk if it did have one.

-M,i,k,e

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So you connect to the internet wirelessly? (Anyone know what wireless manager is installed by default in ubuntu? In kubuntu it is knetworkmanager) Try to connect through that, it is possible drivers for your card are already installed by default (you can google the type of card you have and see) If the card is only supported under windows, you can install ndiswrapper (you need an internet connection, get a wire?) and use your windows driver under linux.

Read full topic

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @M_i_K_e M,i,K,e
item.description:
@M_i_K_e wrote:

Well, yeah old news than.
Anyway, when I would open firefox, and type in say ‘Http://google.com’ it would say ‘Server could not be found at Http://google.com’ and so on.
So, I use a router, well I have two computers, and Ubuntu cannot run .exe, so that’s why. As you cleared up. Also, due to Belkin installation is on an .exe theres the problem.

-M,i,k,e

Read full topic

item.title: Lawl&Shoot
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“M,i,K,e, post:12, topic:157192”]It’s a computer function, it cleans out your hard drive, to how it was as new.
Also, Moparisthebest, while installing the Ubuntu, it said it was deleting the Windows XP, so I dunno. ><

-M,i,k,e[/quote]

It only said that because you told it to, you should have selected the option to resize your windows partition and install ubuntu on a new partition, instead of the option to wipe your entire harddrive like you chose.

Now back to the issue of you saying the internet won’t work on ubuntu, what do you mean by that?

Read full topic

So yeah, you can close this. Thanks for the help.

And legit is right, windows might not be gone, depending on what you did.
